news_header: Apple's new iPhone 16e offers AI features at a lower price, targeting budget-conscious consumers and aiming to boost sales.
news_original_title: Apple gambles on new iPhone with AI features at lower cost
news_text: Apple has introduced the iPhone 16e, featuring AI capabilities at a lower price than its flagship models. The device uses the same processor as the iPhone 16 but has fewer cameras and lower specifications. Analysts are cautious about its potential sales boost, as Apple has struggled with declining iPhone sales. The iPhone 16e will be available for pre-order in 59 countries, priced at £599 in the UK. The device aims to attract budget-conscious consumers and enhance Apple's presence in the AI market.
